[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Fork Conditions] Could non-deterministic deduplication behavior cause validators to execute different sets of transactions, leading to state divergence and chain forks? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Censorship via Duplication] Can an attacker front-run legitimate transactions by submitting duplicates with invalid signatures first, causing the deduper to filter out the legitimate ones later in the block? (High)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 14-17] [Signature Verification Bypass] The comment explicitly states signatures are NOT verified before dedup - can this be exploited to include transactions that will definitely fail verification but still consume dedup resources? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Gas Price Manipulation] Since deduplication happens before gas validation, can an attacker submit the same transaction multiple times with different gas prices to bypass dedup and force validators to validate all copies? (High)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Free Resource Consumption] Can attackers submit blocks full of duplicate transactions that consume validator CPU for hash calculation without paying gas (since duplicates are filtered before execution)? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 24-25] [Hash Calculation Cost] The comment notes hash calculation is expensive - can this be weaponized to slow down specific validators by sending them blocks with maximal possible duplicates? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Mempool Interaction] If transactions are deduplicated at consensus but not in mempool, can validators receive the same transaction through multiple paths and process it multiple times? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Block Proposal Integration] When a validator proposes a block, does it run dedup before or after block creation? Could this create timing windows for duplicate insertion? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Transaction Verification Order] Since dedup happens before signature verification, what's the security impact if a transaction passes dedup but later fails verification? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 68] [Hash Algorithm Security] What hash algorithm does committed_hash() use, and are there known collision attacks that could allow duplicate transactions to pass through? (High)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 68] [Hash Length] Is the hash output length sufficient to prevent birthday attacks where attackers generate colliding transaction hashes? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 82] [Tuple Hash Strength] How is the (hash, authenticator) tuple hashed for HashSet? Could weak tuple hashing allow collisions even with strong individual hashes? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Preimage Attacks] Could an attacker compute transaction preimages that hash to the same value as legitimate transactions to cause incorrect deduplication? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 29-30] [Future Optimization Safety] The comments mention potential parallelization of step 3 - could implementing this introduce race conditions or non-determinism? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 31-33] [Hash Cache Exploitation] If a per-txn hash cache is implemented as suggested, could attackers poison the cache to cause incorrect deduplication? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 34-35] [Signature Verification Move] If signature verification moves before dedup as mentioned, what new attack vectors would this open? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 66] [Parallel Chunk Size] Can attackers exploit the optimal_min_len calculation to cause unbalanced work distribution across validator cores? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Sequence Number Reuse] If two transactions have the same sender and sequence number but different contents, are both correctly kept (as non-duplicates), or could one be incorrectly filtered? (High)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 45] [Sender Address Validation] Does the sender() function handle all account types correctly (regular, multisig, resource accounts), or could account type confusion cause dedup errors? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup()] [Transaction Type Handling] Does dedup handle all transaction types uniformly (user, governance, validator), or could special transaction types bypass deduplication? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 41] [HashMap Security] Does the HashMap use a cryptographically secure hash function, or could hash flooding attacks cause O(nÂ²) performance degradation? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 74] [HashSet Security] Similarly, could HashSet hash flooding slow down duplicate detection to cause consensus timeouts? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 43] [Boolean Vector Size] Could the possible_duplicates boolean vector cause memory issues if the transactions vector is extremely large? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 44-55] [Iteration Order] Does transactions.iter().enumerate() maintain deterministic ordering across all validators regardless of platform? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/txn_hash_and_authenticator_deduper.rs] [Function: dedup() line 76] [Zip Order Guarantee] Does into_iter().zip() guarantee element pairing is preserved in the correct order, or could misalignment occur? (Critical)
